definition: a widow (a widow's way of referring to herself in former times)
not yet/did not/have not/not/8th earthly branch: 1-3 p.m., 6th solar month (7th July-6th August), year of the Sheep/ancient Chinese compass point: 210°
to die/to lose/to be gone/to flee/deceased

sentences.english: Everyone has a tomb, there lived a grave.
sentences.chinese: 每個人心裏都有一座墳，墳裏住着未亡人。

sentences.english: His entrance was followed by that of the widow, whose lamentations filled the room.
sentences.chinese: 未亡人跟着牧師走了進來，她的悲傷瀰漫了整個房間。

sentences.english: I I buried this person in my heart.
sentences.chinese: 心裏有座城，葬着未亡人。

sentences.english: The funeral rites, orchestrated by the widow, were conducted by Buddhist monks.
sentences.chinese: 未亡人貝格請來佛教僧人操持了葬禮。

sentences.english: They help the living to make sense of loss.
sentences.chinese: 這幫助未亡人獲得失去的意義。

sentences.english: But it did list his "survivors" quite accurately.
sentences.chinese: 可是訃告上卻精確地列出了他的“未亡人”。
